text: You're welcome :slightly_smiling_face:
Suggestion: Beautify button or keyboard shortcut, that properly ignores hubl

Found kind of a significant bug. - if you have a field in one of your custom modules with the name “CSS Class” if you use the design manager to edit your field within your module it actually edits the HubSpot wrapper css class at the same time. must be a naming conflict.

We regularly add a “CSS class” field to add specific styling to an area that’s only going to get used in one place or rarely. Also makes our modules more easily transferrable to other HS-Sites. 

I realize that to fix it in my case I can just namespace my variable or something but really the HS variables should atleast be namesspaced like hs_class_name or something, as it’s too easy to unintentionally cause problems.

<https://spin.d.pr/nh0Fs6+>
light grey background for white images with transparency and file-name+extension please :slightly_smiling_face:
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.

question I’ve never really thought about until now.

If I put a macro in a custom module, and I have another custom module and add another macro with the same name, will they conflict or does something prevent that?

not to mention the many cases where the png/svg is white with transparent background :slightly_smiling_face: you have to click on the tiny i icon … so if the file name is displayed at list you have a hint … but whatever … grey/checkerboard bg
i don’t think they will conflict … the names of the fields don’t
Well i did find if you name one “class_name” it screws with HS’s design manager wrapper class name. that’s actually what made me wonder about this.

I’ve mentioned this before, but why is setup-style.css getting loaded in the design previewer?

It doesn’t add much styling but it is adding some, and that adds confusion as to how I need to style different elements in custom modules.
I just cloned a global module, and it doesn’t look like we can select if we want the cloned module to be global or local. It would be nice to be able to clone a global module to create a local one.
did you try this:<https://spin.d.pr/2LQyl0>
Thank you! I do not see the Add or Edit options to get to that screen.
you have to click on the global module/group in the drag n drop builder

And answering your question:
Don't know if custom modules are different (I had problems as I had different declarations inside the template and head etc.)., but anyway, you will have the macro declared at the start of each custom module, so it will output the version it has in each CM. (overwriting or not, but with the right result)

I’m using coded files so I don’t believe I have that option. I have the global module open in the design manager and selected ‘clone module’ from the ‘File’ dropdown. The global module content is apparently not editable within the page. I’m working on creating a local version of the module so I can edit it in individual pages. If there are other settings that exist to make this easier, I would love to know about them. Thanks!
:confused: sorry not sure. We always try to use the Drag n Drop builder as much as possible(gives clients more control without them needing to learn to code)

When using the HubDB Tag in a custom module, if your page is going to have dynamic pages with the module, you still need to choose the DB from the page settings. Can this be modified so if you are using a HubDB tag on a page in a module, it would automatically set the page settings to use that DB?
otherwise HubDB doesnt help when doing dynamic pages
